race.name: Humanoids
race.description: El equipo original del planeta Plantigrado, compuesto en su totalidad por úrsidos descendientes de Masha y Misha, los primeros colonizadores llegados en una antigua cápsula Soyuz. Juegan por hacer oír la voz de su planeta, en el punto de mira de las grandes corporaciones mineras como Third Kind. El honor, la igualdad y la naturaleza son sus valores. La fuerza y la garra (literalmente) sus armas.

character.name: Aleksei Rollan
character.description: He's promised to wear a mask until his planet, Plantigrade, is free of foreign threats. He would be willing to die on the pitch for his team's honour and his compatriots' rights.
character.motto: "If I show you my face, it will be the last thing you see."

character.name: Leonid Arkaimovich
character.description: In his commitment to a fairer planet, Leonid Arkaimovich is a Plantigrader determined to check his privileges and change male roles. As part of this endeavour, he's using CyberMarsupial technology to take care of his child 24 hours a day, even on the pitch.
character.motto: "He who plays for himself, only plays. He who plays for the future of his children, makes war."

character.name: Moustakim Vitalievich
character.description: Prudence, wisdom and empathy with the environment have equipped this charismatic bear with an unrivalled skill on the pitch. Before each match, he practises transcendental meditation for an hour. But after the kick-off, there's no peace: the bear unsheathes his claws in the knowledge that life is fleeting... especially in the case of his rivals.
character.motto: "I never lose patience, but sometimes patience loses me."

character.name: Yaroslav Llyich
character.description: He became a hero in the fight for his planet's freedom by harassing the enemy from the forest, striking and then making a rapid retreat. Now he's deploying all that talent in sport as a means of drawing attention to Plantigrade's cause.
character.motto: "Where I come from, putting your paw in it means destroying the enemy."

character.name: David Guralev
character.description: The technology discovered in the archives of Sputnik 2.2. has enormous potential when combined with the hyperdeveloped brains of the ursine inhabitants of Plantigrade. For example, the bears' knowledge has led to inventions like David Guralev's cyberstilts, enabling him to overcome the permanent paralysis he suffers from following a clash with the Radiostar Freaks. He's managed to rejoin the team in tip-top form.
character.motto: "My legs are full of tungsten, my heart full of victories."

character.name: Pavel Kirillovich
character.description: His family is not descended from the bears of the first Sputnik that reached Plantigrade. They emigrated there as simple ant bears who evolved as quickly as the descendants of Misha and Masha. This explains his foreign name and exotic race, but Pavel's heart belongs to Plantigrade, home to his family and friends, as well as the finest ants in the galaxy. He will give everything he has to win glory for his planet.
character.motto: "I will crush my enemies like ants and devour them… like… like ants."

character.name: Kirill Georgiy
character.description: There's no taboo about age among the ursine inhabitants of Plantigrade. The fact that their brain matures so quickly makes them excellent Aces of Multiverse fighters or players from a very young age. Kirill is a case in point. At just 10 years old, he's already making a name for himself in the professional leagues of this sport and is passionately defending his planet's colours.
character.motto: "This is child's play for me."

character.name: Aleksei Rollan
character.description: He's promised to wear a mask until his planet, Plantigrade, is free of foreign threats. He would be willing to die on the pitch for his team's honour and his compatriots' rights.
character.motto: "If I show you my face, it will be the last thing you see."

The fact that their brain matures so quickly makes them excellent Aces of Multiverse fighters or players from a very young age. Kirill is a case in point. At just 10 years old, he's already making a name for himself in the professional leagues of this sport and is passionately defending his planet's colours.

character.name: Moustakim Vitalievich
character.description: Prudence, wisdom and empathy with the environment have equipped this charismatic bear with an unrivalled skill on the pitch. Before each match, he practises transcendental meditation for an hour. But after the kick-off, there's no peace: the bear unsheathes his claws in the knowledge that life is fleeting... especially in the case of his rivals.
character.motto: "I never lose patience, but sometimes patience loses me."

character.name: Ruslan Antonov
character.description: Born in a Plantigrade lab, Ruslan is a clone perfected with genetic material from the great legend that all ursine inhabitants of the planet worship: Yuri Gagarin. A toenail of the first cosmonaut appeared in Sputnik 2.2, the spaceship that colonised Plantigrade. Scientists incubated the cells and gave them a supernatural talent for playing Aces of Multiverse.
character.motto: "I'll kill you with gagarins!»

character.name: Ruslan Antonov
character.description: Born in a Plantigrade lab, Ruslan is a clone perfected with genetic material from the great legend that all ursine inhabitants of the planet worship: Yuri Gagarin. A toenail of the first cosmonaut appeared in Sputnik 2.2, the spaceship that colonised Plantigrade. Scientists incubated the cells and gave them a supernatural talent for playing Aces of Multiverse.
character.motto: "I'll kill you with gagarins!»

race.name: Muntants
race.description: Un equipo formado enteramente por mutantes para defender la causa mutante. Son supervivientes del virus del moquillo radiactivo, que se propagó tras la explosión de la Supernova Kaar 23030, y que transmite, además de la enfermedad, las características genéticas de un huésped al siguiente (de ahí las mutaciones). Juegan para dar visibilidad a sus problemas, sobre todo para que se liberalice la patente de la vacuna contra dicho virus, en manos de industrias Third Kind.

character.name: God
character.description: He was a baby when he contracted the radioactive distemper that affected his DNA and turned him into a mortal radioactive creature with a hyperdeveloped brain in the body of an infant mutant.
character.motto: "All babies are beautiful… But they don't all become mortal radioactive mutants like me."

character.name: Uqeols
character.motto: "Everyone wants to cuddle me, until they realise I'm breaking their bones."
character.description: Radioactive distemper modified his DNA with bat, orangutan and parakeet genes. He looks mild and easy-going, but appearances are deceptive. He actually has a very short fuse, especially when provoked.

character.name: Bymheads
character.description: Bymheads is an example of what happens when you mix alien DNA from different galaxies with viral radiation. An impossible and highly unpredictable creature - you never know what ability or behaviour he's about to deploy.
character.motto: "While you're still wondering what I am, I've already beaten you hands down."

character.name: Ahreaks
character.description: Turned into a humanoid ant by active distemper, Ahreaks uses his worker mentality mid-field but thinks collectively as if the team were his own anthill.
character.motto: "The individual is not important. The only thing that matters is the team or anthill."

character.name: Scimpheak
character.description: An anarchist supermammal with radioactive genes and an evil temper. Scimpheak used to be a squatter in Leeds and has used her elbows and long neck to scale the heights of Aces of Multiverse. Today she is one of the top scorers.
character.motto: "Raise your head to look me in the face and I'll spit in your eye."

character.name: Sedruol
character.description: They say she comes from an aristocratic family but she contracted radioactive distemper and fled in shame from her noble surroundings. For a mono-organic mutant (a single organ - in this case an eye - that acquires all the functions of an individual) like Sedruol, things are always simple. She has a clear vision of the game and can anticipate her opponents' moves like a clairvoyant. Seeing is believing.
character.motto: "Staring at them is the very least I inflict on my opponents."

character.name: Aivlys
character.description: He ate poached eggs infected with radioactive distemper and his DNA turned him into a humanoid cockatoo. He has a sharp beak for provoking his rivals and he likes to think that when  he's on the pitch, the team's victory is only one egg away.
character.motto: "After the egg comes the hen. And after the hen, victory."

character.name: God
character.description: He was a baby when he contracted the radioactive distemper that affected his DNA and turned him into a mortal radioactive creature with a hyperdeveloped brain in the body of an infant mutant.
character.motto: "All babies are beautiful… But they don't all become mortal radioactive mutants like me."

character.motto: "After the egg comes the hen. And after the hen, victory."

character.name: Ahreaks
character.description: Turned into a humanoid ant by active distemper, Ahreaks uses his worker mentality mid-field but thinks collectively as if the team were his own anthill.
character.motto: "The individual is not important. The only thing that matters is the team or anthill."

character.name: Zapiram
character.description: Born on planet Protozoolia, Zapiram originally looked like an amoebamorph, i.e. a formless 60kg cell, a giant amoeba. After contracting radioactive distemper, her DNA became infested with Homo sapiens genes and she was horrified when she eventually mutated into a humanoid. Now, whenever she looks in the mirror, she misses her sculptural sticky protozoic shape, which fills her with fury before every match.
character.motto: "I've lost my original appearance, so I couldn't care less about keeping up appearances with my rivals."

character.name: Zapiram
character.description: Born on planet Protozoolia, Zapiram originally looked like an amoebamorph, i.e. a formless 60kg cell, a giant amoeba. After contracting radioactive distemper, her DNA became infested with Homo sapiens genes and she was horrified when she eventually mutated into a humanoid. Now, whenever she looks in the mirror, she misses her sculptural sticky protozoic shape, which fills her with fury before every match.
character.motto: "I've lost my original appearance, so I couldn't care less about keeping up appearances with my rivals."

race.name: Robots
race.description: Los primeros androides con autoconciencia y capaces de reproducirse a sí mismos ya están aquí, y no han tardado en reivindicar su derecho a ser considerados personas. Pero eso lleva tiempo y no todos los habitantes de todos los multiversos están dispuestos a aceptar. Muchos, los siguen viendo como cacharros sin alma. Aunque todavía anden algo flojos de empatía, los Electro Killers aprovecharán su popularidad para impedir que ningún robot vuelva a ser explotado.

character.name: Summerstride
character.description: It built its stamping system with the boot of the first rival it humiliated on a pitch. Some even believe that poor adversary's foot is still inside the boot. The only way to find out the truth is to take it apart, but it's not going to do that any time soon.
character.motto: "I respond to the following algorithm: Take the ball off me and you'll feel my boot in your face."

character.name: Havenscream
character.description: It's proud of being a "self-made" robot... literally! It started as a simple robotic little finger that collected scrap for a living. Little by little, with the surplus pieces of metal it saved in a biscuit tin, it built itself a whole body. Today it's a top player, an example for all those just starting out and in need of motivation.
character.motto: "They can demand a software update of me but they'll never take my freedom."

character.name: Freesteam
character.description: Designed as Robbie9, on a forbidden planet, and in service to a mad doctor bent on kidnapping a famous scientist's children, now that it's finally free it's ditched its slave name and all it wants to do is play Aces of Multiverse and escape its shady past.
character.motto: "They can demand a software update of me but they'll never take my freedom."

character.name: Snakegrain
character.description: It was designed to detonate planet-killing nuclear weapons, but before the liberation of robots its lethal circuits were removed. Now it plays Aces of Multiverse during the day and spends its nights trying to retrieve its former components, without which it feels empty. What will it do when it finds them? Well, we'd rather not be on that plane of the multiverse when it happens.
character.motto: "Playing against me is the bomb."

character.name: Ironthorn
character.description: It was designed to detonate planet-killing nuclear weapons, but before the liberation of robots its lethal circuits were removed. Now it plays Aces of Multiverse during the day and spends its nights trying to retrieve its former components, without which it feels empty. What will it do when it finds them? Well, we'd rather not be on that plane of the multiverse when it happens.
character.motto: "Want a new roll of paper? Then buy one!"

character.name: Leafreaper
character.description: Can an innovative health robot specialising in obstetric surgery become an impetuous Aces of Multiverse player? It sure can! After the liberation of robots, this android turned its loving pincers, originally designed to caress newborn babies, into two mortal weapons capable of cutting its rivals into two.
character.motto: "My pincers will caress you right through to your bones."

character.name: Distantglade
character.description: It lived in a warehouse during its years of slavery because its operating system never enjoyed the commercial success of its competitors and no buyer was every found. After the liberation it had to go out and look for its life's destiny, which it soon found: playing Aces of Multiverse.
character.motto: "I don't like people with no metal inside them. That's why I fill them with lead."

character.name: Summerstride
character.description: It built its stamping system with the boot of the first rival it humiliated on a pitch. Some even believe that poor adversary's foot is still inside the boot. The only way to find out the truth is to take it apart, but it's not going to do that any time soon.
character.motto: "I respond to the following algorithm: Take the ball off me and you'll feel my boot in your face."

character.name: Freesteam
character.description: Designed as Robbie9, on a forbidden planet, and in service to a mad doctor bent on kidnapping a famous scientist's children, now that it's finally free it's ditched its slave name and all it wants to do is play Aces of Multiverse and escape its shady past.
character.motto: "They can demand a software update of me but they'll never take my freedom."

character.name: Downjumper
character.description: Sick of watching humans use robotic pieces to improve their bodies (therefore becoming cyborgs), it was the first robot to do the opposite: reinforce its hardware with human organs. With lungs to optimise the expulsion of gases, a pituitary gland to detect molecules and a large intestine to make its rivals feel a little nauseous, this android is the first roborg ever created.
character.motto: "I do have a soft side, but that's not the one I'm going to use to crush you."

character.name: Downjumper
character.description: Sick of watching humans use robotic pieces to improve their bodies (therefore becoming cyborgs), it was the first robot to do the opposite: reinforce its hardware with human organs. With lungs to optimise the expulsion of gases, a pituitary gland to detect molecules and a large intestine to make its rivals feel a little nauseous, this android is the first roborg ever created.
character.motto: "I do have a soft side, but that's not the one I'm going to use to crush you."

object.name: ElectricProtectionWires
object.description: An electrified defensive perimeter so your attackers think twice before striking you. +2 STRENGTH

object.name: BioEnergy
object.description: A drug that draws energy from the microbiota in your organism to gain striking power. STRENGTH +2

object.name: WindPowerGeneration
object.description: Directs draughts to propel the ball. +2 LAUNCH

object.name: NexusBrain6Unity
object.description: A replicant's brain to increase your neural efficiency. +2 SKILL

object.name: MagneticEyes
object.description: Cybernetic eye grafts to see way beyond the visible spectrum of light. +2 STRENGTH

object.name: NeuralLace
object.description: Nano brain graft to intensify neural connections and improve the wearer's skill. +2 SKILL

object.name: AccelerationShell
object.description: Capsule-suit to reduce the gravitational pull and allow the wearer to move faster. +2 SPEED

object.name: SteelTentacle
object.description: Autonomous reinforced limb for protection from enemy attacks. +2 STRENGTH

object.name: SpaceSick
object.description: Ballistic nano particles launched against the nerve centres of your adversaries every time you strike them. They increase the possibility of hurting them or knocking them out cold.

object.name: GyroHat
object.description: A hat that operates with reverse reflection: the dafter you look to your enemies, the greater your skill. +2 SKILL

object.name: MagnetizedBoots
object.description: Made out of enriched melatonin, these boots give the wearer extra strength and skill but the weight diminishes other abilities. +2 STRENGTH +2 SKILL -2 LAUNCH -2 SPEED

object.name: ImpactSuit
object.description: The arachnostellar silk fabric increases the wearer's strength but hinders certain movements. +3 STRENGTH -1 LAUNCH -1 SKILL

object.name: HeavyImpactor
object.description: Body lotion with nano active ingredients that invigorate muscle fibres, increasing the wearer's strength and possibilities of injuring or eliminating the adversary. +2 STRENGTH

object.name: DimensoScope
object.description: Enables the wearer to see in more than three dimensions, improving launch and skill but with repercussions on other abilities. +2 LAUNCH +2 SKILL -3 SPEED

object.name: Weightlessness
object.description: Emits antigravitons that reduce the weight of the players of both teams, also reducing the harm caused by impacts and increasing the players' speed. +2 SPEED -2 IMPACTS (both teams)

object.name: NullSuit
object.description: Quantum linking suit that pairs your particles with those of your attacker, with the result that he receives the strength of his own impact.

event.name: CounterMachine
event.description: Produces an electromagnetic pulse that immediately uses up all the time allocated to a rival team's ability.

event.name: GravityBelt
event.description: Whoever touches the person wearing this belt will immediately feel the influence of anti-gravity.

event.name: AirBarriers
event.description: Super-thick air barriers to hinder access to your goal.

event.name: SuspendedAnimationSystem
event.description: Cocktail of drugs that slows down your adversaries' metabolism, reducing their speed by 10% with every dose.

event.name: TelePomp
event.description: Teleporter of matter, handy for sending your adversaries to the other end of the pitch.

event.name: BigPush
event.description: Linear particle accelerator to knock down the first rival you impact on a straight line, applying a +10 STRENGTH.

event.name: DisruptorBomb
event.description: Generates a deafening blast that greatly reduces the agility and skill of both teams. -5 SKILL -5 AGILITY

event.name: BetaBeamSatellite
event.description: Your spaceship puts a satellite in orbit armed with a laser beam for toasting your opponents.

event.name: CatchPocket
event.description: Records recent quantum activity so that you can replicate the last experimental equipment that any player has used.

event.name: Nullfield
event.description: Nullifies your opponents experimental equipment throughout the match.

text: What a great multiplace the multiverse is! On our Earth we still don't know how delicious saturated multifats are or how comfortable parallel reality chairs are.

Neither do we know anything about your inhabitants' enormous health problems caused by poor diet and a sedentary lifestyle: obesity, diabetes and Schmidmaartprrrinfir'ar'ar syndrome. This is the story of the first three teams that entered the competition.

Fortunately, they do know what's happening and have even declared a multiversal health crisis. Several quantum years ago, the transdimensional spaceships sent by Third Kind Industries discovered an insignificant planet where they seemed to know the remedy.
That remedy was the Earth. And the solution was sport.

And so the Aces of Multiverse was born. Such was its popularity that it became a platform for the strangest causes of every possible universe. From the formless protozoic planets of dimension 340 to the hyperindustrialised Moon-Headquarters of Third Kind Industries in the Premiumverse, more and more alternative worlds are entering the competition, not only to claim their rights but to defend perverse interests... all while keeping in shape.
This is the story of the first three teams that entered the competition.
Quantum reality may be tiny, but this victory makes it a little more beautiful.
The Aces of Multiverse league has many more secrets, surprises and victories in store. But it needs something: more Aces.

storynode.title: CHAPTER 1. SPUTNIK BEARS VS RADIOSTAR FREAKS

text: Planet Plantigrade is on the verge of total destruction! Exploitation of its natural resources is destroying it!

The Sputnik Bears were the first team to realise that sport was not only a way of keeping fit but also of defending their noble motives. They are fighting to carry the voice of their native land to the entire Multiverse. But it's no easy task. The Radiostar Freaks, the team of dangerous radioactive mutants, are going to make it very difficult for them.

As virulent rivals, the two teams have already engaged in some epic battles. It all started when the mutants were accused of polluting Plantigrade's natural beauty spots with radioactive isotopes hidden inside regulation balls. At their next encounter, the Sputnik Bears turned their opponents' changing room into a bears' latrine. The Radiostar Freaks sponsors retaliated by putting a fast-food restaurant serving dishes made with enriched uranium in the orbit of Plantigrade. The last time the two teams came head-to-head, the Radiostar Freaks won in the last second after snatching the ball from David Guralev, who sustained an injury with permanent consequences.
Now the ball is in the Sputnik Bears' court. Will they get their revenge?

storynode.title: CHAPTER 2. RADIOSTAR FREAKS VS. ELECTRO KILLERS

text: The vaccine against the mutagenic virus of radioactive distemper has been invented but the multiversal corporations are blocking the patent!
The Radio Star Freaks are leading the campaign against this injustice. The Electro Killers, the powerful team of freed robots, will be the next obstacle to beat.

At their first encounter, the robots refused to compute the mutants as "people", so the mutants decided to treat the robots as toasters. At a later tournament, the mutants simply twiddled their limbs while the Electro Killers performed the "Dance of the Robot", a sacred hacka.
At their last match, the Electro Killers won by three goals, which they celebrated with a drum roll of canned laughter. Will the Radiostar Freaks be able to strike back?

storynode.title: CHAPTER 3. ELECTRO KILLERS VS. SPUTNIK BEARS

text: The robots have won their rights but the battle isn't over: they still have to consolidate them!
The Electro Killers will defend their cause on the pitch. Beating the arrogant Sputnik Bears will be quite a challenge.

The ursine inhabitants of Plantigrade blame autonomous technology for many of the misfortunes on their planet, and they have no qualms about demonstrating that the mind is far superior to the microprocessor. At one of their recent encounters, they made tin toothpicks out of the remains of a disconnected robot to enrage the Electro Killers. These retaliated at the return match by putting on a circus show of cycling bears during the interval.

At the last encounter, the bears won by just one goal and declared that he who has no flesh has no honour. Will the Electro Killers be able to demonstrate who claims honour and who can keep their flesh?

team.name: Sputnik Bears
team.description: The original team from planet Plantigrade, made up entirely of ursine descendants of Masha and Misha, the first settlers who arrived to colonise the planet in an ancient Soyuz capsule. They play to raise awareness about the planet, now targeted by major mining corporations like Third Kind. Honour, equality and nature are their values. Strength and courage are their weapons.

team.name: xXx Cosmopaws
team.description: These play Aces of Multiverse to finance their "radical cosmonaut" expeditions. Aided by their two robots, these three "extreme cosmonaut" bears hold the records for the greatest distance in an analogue capsule, a space walk during apnea and a journey with extended hibernation. In another major feat, they reached Plantigrade's first moon by holding their breath in a barrel of smoked herring.

team.name: Barely Bears
team.description: In D404 universe, wars with the Third Kind corporation have depleted the Plantigrade youth. To complete an ursine team, the Barely Bears have inserted a new value into the program of two robots: protecting the nature and honour of theirplanet.

team.name: Radiostar Freaks
team.description: A team made up entirely of mutants to defend the mutant cause. They are survivers of the radioactive distemper virus, which spread after the explosion of Supernova Kaar 23030 and which transmits the desease as well as the genetic characteristics of one host to the next (hence the mutations). They play to raise awareness about their problems, and especially to secure the release of the patent for the vaccine against the virus, currently in the hands of Third Kind Industries.

team.name: Cesius Mayhem
team.description: Determined to win the Aces of Multiverse title at any cost, these mutants have kidnapped the son of the Plantigrade star Aleksei Rollan and are threatening to infect him with radioactive distemper and turn him into a mutant unless his father plays with them and puts his heart and soul into it. Aleksei has no choice but to go along with them, and in any case he's incapable of giving anything less than his best on the pitch.

team.name: Bizarre Sisters
team.description: The recruitment of Zapiram has served to empower the female players on the mutant team from D303 universe. In this parallel reality, the stratospheric ace of Protozolia	 planet will only play if her companions are in the initial team. "Anyone who doesn't like it," she says, "can go and take a swim in protoplasm". The results so far are indisputable.

team.name: Electro Killers
team.description: The first androids with self-awareness and the ability to reproduce are here, and they have been quick to claim their right to be treated as people. But that will take time because some of the inhabitants of some of the different multiverses are not willing to accept them. In fact, many still see them as soulless pieces of junk. Although they still have an underdeveloped sense of empathy, the Electro Killers will use their popularity to prevent robots from ever being exploited again.

team.name: Pseudochips Mix
team.description: The existence of this team from the Confused Dimension is all based on mistake. In the first place, the name is a mistake: it sounds like the brand of a packet of crisps. Secondly, the robots have mistakenly signed two players who they thought were machines but who are actually bears with cybernetic support systems. And thirdly, the bears have mistakenly accepted because they thought they were signing then lease agreement for a new interdimensional spaceship. What there is no mistake about is how they perform on the pitch: since they've ended up with this strange mix of microchips and organic tissue, they're determined to go all out to win.

team.name: Robo Dancer
team.description: Ever since the invention of artificial intelligence, humans have dreamed of being able to dance like a robot but they’ve never managed it. That's why the robotic team from Z404 universe use this funny dance to humiliate their defeated adversaries. Defeated because their ranks include the awesome Downjumper, so the encounter rarely ends any other way.
